alert.note: Alert for Athens; Gallia; Jackson; Meigs; Vinton; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Meigs, northeastern Gallia, southwestern Washington, northeastern Jackson, Vinton, southern Athens and northwestern Mason Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mcarthur, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Athens, Wellston, Point Pleasant, Pomeroy, Mcarthur, Albany, Rutland, Lake Hope State Park, Mason, Middleport, Hamden, Syracuse, Hartford City, Coalton, Zaleski, Henderson, Vinton, Wilkesville, Cheshire and Radcliffe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Athens; Gallia; Jackson; Meigs; Vinton; Washington
